items.summary: Add a new user role named "client" across the app, so users can register and be treated distinctly from students, businesses, and freelancers/helpers.

Update the landing ("/") experience to include a clear entry selection section with exactly three prominent options: "Student", "Client", and "Business", using appealing transition-style typography/animation consistent with the current site style (do not redesign the overall theme).

Update the Create Account flow to support the new "Client" role and keep existing roles working; ensure all user-facing role labels are in English and consistent (Student, Client, Business, and existing Freelancer/Helper if still supported).

Upgrade the authenticated request submission form (currently routed at "/work-request") to capture and submit, for Student/Client/Business: Name, Age, Title, and Description (with role-specific helper text/examples matching the user request).

Add submission mode options "Online" and "Offline" to the request form for Student/Client/Business. If "Offline" is selected, show an on-screen notification containing exactly: "Meet at Moon Bake, Kengeri Satellite Town, Bangalore 560060." and ensure the submitted request is marked/stored as offline with that location information.

Ensure that after Student/Client/Business submit a request, it is visible to the owner/admin for review in the existing owner inbox and detail pages, and the owner can accept or reject it and initiate conversation with the user.

Implement acceptance/rejection notifications to the submitting user: when the owner/admin accepts a request, the user receives a confirmation message; when rejected, the user receives a rejection message encouraging them to try again. Notifications must be in English and delivered within the app (e.g., as an automatic chat/system message tied to the request, and/or a status banner in the user dashboard).

Preserve the existing website look-and-feel while implementing the above changes; do not introduce a new theme. If any new UI elements are added (entry selection, new fields, online/offline controls), they must reuse the existing glass/gradient/animation patterns already present in the app for a consistent experience across devices.

Provide a comprehensive implementation guide/design specification inside the repo that documents: roles (Student/Client/Business/Helper/Admin), the entry-selection flow, all form fields, submission-mode behavior (Online/Offline + Moon Bake notice), and the accept/reject notification behavior (including exact user-facing message copy).
